title: Why Rent Control Doesn’t Work (Ep. 373 Rebroadcast)
description: As cities become ever-more expensive, politicians and housing advocates keep calling for rent control. Economists think that’s a terrible idea. They say it helps a small (albeit noisy) group of renters, but keeps overall rents artificially high by disincentivizing new construction. So what happens next?
author: editor@freakonomics.com (Freakonomics Radio + Stitcher)
